meanings.definition: To grow (two or more crops) together in the same area.
meanings.sent1: The farmer intercropped corn and beans in his field to maximize space.
meanings.sent2: Farmers often intercropped different vegetables to improve soil health.
meanings.sent3: The intercropped plants in the garden seemed to be having a friendly competition for sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The way the crops intercropped created a beautiful mosaic of colors in the field.
meanings.sent5: The practice of intercropping can lead to a more sustainable agricultural system.

meanings.definition: Grown together in the same area.
meanings.sent1: The intercropped plants shared nutrients and space effectively.
meanings.sent2: The intercropped fields displayed a harmonious blend of different crops.
meanings.sent3: The intercropped flowers in the garden attracted a variety of pollinators.
meanings.sent4: The intercropped trees provided a natural canopy for the smaller plants below.
meanings.sent5: The intercropped area looked like a vibrant patchwork quilt of vegetation.
